rooms.description: Spacious corridor aligned with Vastu principles for entry. Features traditional Kerala-style stone flooring and natural ventilation openings.
A central space with large windows and high ceilings to allow ample natural light, complemented by hand-carved wooden beams in the ceiling. Vastu orientation ensures energy flow.
Integrated dining area adjacent to the living room with traditional Kerala woodwork and open-plan design facilitating ventilation.
Functionally designed kitchen with modern appliances integrated into a traditional layout, featuring large windows for natural light and improved air circulation.
Dedicated space for domestic help positioned in a quieter corner of the ground floor to promote privacy while ensuring proper ventilation and lighting.
A semi-open area that connects living areas, promoting cross-ventilation and natural light. Traditional Kerala features include jali screens for privacy and aesthetic appeal.

openings.description: Large entryway designed in accordance with Vastu principles, ensuring auspicious energy flow. Includes natural stone pathway and traditional Kerala door design.
Secondary entrance facilitating service access for servant quarters, aligned with local building norms.
